page.title: 03FARMING - PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: Marshall's Farm keeps 140 Friesian (black and white) cows. Lowfold has 140 Friesians and 180 pigs. Friesians, nicknamed 'water carts', are popular in 1985 because their milk is less creamy than Jerseys', and the modern slimming craze demands less cream; this also reduces blood cholesterol. Gownfold keep 20 cows on 60 acres of pastureland. The Milk Marketing Board lorries collect the milk from these farms daily. Buckfold keep beef cattle and four cows for breeding; unwanted calves are sold at Guildford Market. Linfold Farm is for sale and their Friesian herd reduced to 12. Idehurst Farmhouse is now a private house and fields are let in units of 10 and 17 acres for small Friesian and beef cattle herds. The little 'smallholding' of Bulchins has just 2 heifers and some poultry.
